availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Mitchell Michael Black (Boone County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Boone County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary "Polly" Shultz Black. Father of James H. Black, William J. Black, Margaret Julia Black Ross, G. W. Black, J. T. Black, W. I. Black, and Elizabeth Black. Farmer in Boone County in 1840. Farmer in Boone County in 1850. Farmer in Boone County in 1860. Employed William J. Black and J. T. Black as farmhands in Boone County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, p. 245.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, District 2, p. 152A.

Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Boone County Administration Bonds, 1867-1921, p. 39.
